intro: Micromeria tenuis, commonly known as the slender micromeria, is a small, annual herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and the plant is characterized by its compact growth habit. Micromeria tenuis is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
